summary: Over the 6‑hour window winds were low on average (≈2.7 m/s, std ≈1.04) with a brief peak to 10 m/s, while electrical output stayed essentially at zero (mean ≈−0.004, very low variability). Control surfaces were held near 88°, yaw misalignment averaged about 29°, and the operational state was marked non‑normal for the entire period; rotor speed was very stable (std ≈0.21) whereas generator speed showed much higher variability (std ≈27.8), temperatures were ~30°C, and power residuals remained small (~0.0038).
